Table of Contents

Namespace osu.Framework.Graphics

Classes

BufferedDrawNode
BufferedDrawNodeSharedData

Contains data which is shared between all BufferedDrawNodes of a Drawable.

Component

An updateable component that can be inserted into the draw hierarchy. This is currently used as a marker for cases where nothing more than load, update, lifetime support and hierarchy presence are required. Eventually this will be fleshed out (and the inheritance will be reversed to Drawable : Component).

DrawNode

Contains all the information required to draw a single Drawable. A hierarchy of DrawNodes is passed to the draw thread for rendering every frame.

Drawable

Drawables are the basic building blocks of a scene graph in this framework. Anything that is visible or that the user interacts with has to be a Drawable.

For example:

  • Boxes
  • Sprites
  • Collections of Drawables

Drawables are always rectangular in shape in their local coordinate system, which makes them quad-shaped in arbitrary (linearly transformed) coordinate systems.

Drawable.InvalidThreadForMutationException
DrawableExtensions

Holds extension methods for Drawable.

FrameworkColour
FrameworkFont
TexturedShaderDrawNode
TransformSequenceExtensions
TransformableExtensions
Vector2Extensions

Structs

BlendingParameters

Contains information about how an IDrawable should be blended into its destination.

Colour4

Represents an RGBA colour in the linear colour space, having colour components in the range 0-1. Stored internally as a Vector4 for performance.

DrawColourInfo
DrawInfo
MarginPadding

Holds data about the margin or padding of a Drawable. The margin describes the size of an empty area around its Drawable, while the padding describes the size of an empty area inside its container.

Interfaces

IBufferedDrawable

Interface for Drawables which can be drawn by a BufferedDrawNode.

ICompositeDrawNode

Interface for DrawNodes which compose child DrawNodes. DrawNodes implementing this interface can be used in CompositeDrawables.

IDrawable

Exposes various properties that are part of the public interface of Drawable. This interface should generally NOT be implemented by other classes than Drawable, but only used to specify that an object is of type Drawable. It is mostly useful in cases where you need to specify additional constraints on a Drawable, but also do not want to force inheriting from any particular subclass of Drawable.

ITexturedShaderDrawable

Interface for Drawables which can be drawn by TexturedShaderDrawNodes.

Enums

Anchor

General enum to specify an "anchor" or "origin" point from the standard 9 points on a rectangle. x and y counterparts can be accessed using bitwise flags.

Axes
BlendingEquation
BlendingMask

Represents colour component flags used for colour write mask during blending.

BlendingType
Direction
Easing

See http://easings.net/ for more samples.

Edges
FillMode

Controls the behavior of RelativeSizeAxes when it is set to Both.

Invalidation

Specifies which type of properties are being invalidated.

LoadState

Possible states of a Drawable within the loading pipeline.

RotationDirection
